1615112255_1JTx34tPsJsZT8WWGEih4c8kxeY2k.body:
docker run -d -e "ENABLE_TOR=true" -v ~/zeronet:/root/data -p 15441:15441 -p 127.0.0.1:43110:43110 nofish/zeronet

open tor broken and go to about:config and search network.proxy.no_proxies_on and add 127.0.0.1 to the list

last step is to open noScript settings and add http://127.0.0.1:43110 to per site permissons, this is reset every time to close the browser so you'll need to redo this step

> [xanadu](#comment_14_1JTx34tPsJsZT8WWGEih4c8kxeY2kk89gH): Any chance you have docker-compose :D

just made this for you

    version: '2.3'
    services:
      zeronet:
        image:  nofish/zeronet 
        volumes:
          - ./zeronet:/root/data
        ports:
          - 15441:15441 
          - 43110:43110

> [sabretooth](#comment_6_1CQJfkvNg44WkoH6xCTj6XkuxA9zRMLYSU): You'll find very few informed people agree with that, especially with how they're doing in the CPU market.

and the fact that their GPU section is actually ATI and although owned by AMD is it s own entity.

back when AMD released althon it shat all over intel, there was nothing they could do to keep up and had to result to hammer up the voltage and clocks just to keep up which increaed both power consumption and heat.

Then intel came out with the core series this was a major win and AMD came out with the FX, which on paper was actually a very good designed it `lacked` in single threads and had slower performance as it had only 1 floating point unit per 2 cores. 

Ryzen however is amazing design, allowing for high yields from the FAB, lower power consumption and very high core count.

There is no doubt that this is athlon all over again for amd, intel are getting spanked and AMD is loving it.
